Description: Body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior glazed (fired red); exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 191 is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd. There are very few diagnostic features remaining on the sherd. South Ionian cup types found at Naukratis might date as early as 640BC or as late as 500BC, though other material is not earlier than circa 610BC.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 191)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 658, no. 152)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.256, no.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.239) (Phase 3)
